intro: Disciphania ernstii var. uncinulata, commonly known as the hooked disciphania, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
